English: His killing of two other jurists, men of Sind, who were in his service.

Arabic: وأمر السلطان هذين الفقيهين السنديين أن يمضيا مع أمير عَيَّنَه إلى بعض البلاد،
English: The Sultan commanded these two Sindl jurists to accompany an amir whom he had appointed to a certain province,

Arabic: وقال لهما: إنما سلمت أحوال البلاد والرعية لكما، ويكون هذا الأمير معكما يتصرف بما تأمرانه به،
English: and said to them ‘I have committed the affairs of the province and its population to you two, and this amTr will go with you only to carry out your instructions to him,’

Arabic: فقالا له: إنما نكون كالشاهدين عليه ونبين له وَجْه الحق ليتبعه،
English: They said to him, ‘We should act only as legal witnesses to his administration, and show him the right line of conduct for him to follow,’

Arabic: فقال لهما: إنما قَصْدكما أن تأكلا أموالي وتضيعاها وتنسبا ذلك إلى هذا التركي الذي لا معرفة له،
English: whereupon he replied ‘All that you want is to devour my revenues and squander them, and lay the blame for it on this Turk, who has no experience,’

Arabic: فقالا له: حاشا لله يا خوند عالم ما قَصَدْنا هذا، فقال لهما: لم تَقْصِدا غير هذا،
English: They said ‘God forbid, O Master of the World; this was not our intention,’ but he replied to them ‘You had no other intention.

Arabic: اذهبوا بهما إلى الشيخ زاده النهاوندي وهو الموكل بالعذاب،
English: Take them off to the Shaikh-zada al-NihawandT,’ that is, the officer in charge of punishment by torture.

Arabic: فذُهِبَ بهما إليه
English: When they were taken to him,

Arabic: فقال لهما: السلطان يريد قَتْلكما فأَقِرَّا بما قولكما إياه ولا تعذبا أنفسكما،
English: he said to them, ‘The Sultan intends to put you to death anyway, so admit what he put it into your mouths to say, and don’t expose yourselves to the torture.’

Arabic: فقالا: والله ما قصدنا إلَّا ما ذكرنا،
English: But they swore, by God, they had meant nothing more than they had said,

Arabic: فقال لزبانيته: ذَوِّقْهما بعض شيء يعني من العذاب،
English: so he said to his tormentors ‘Give them a taste of something,’ meaning of torture.

Arabic: فبُطِحَا على أقفائهما وجُعِلَ على صدر كل واحد منهما صفيحة حديد محماة، ثمَّ قُلِعَتْ بعد هنيهة فذهب بلحم صدورهما،
English: They were laid flat upon their backs and on the chest of each of them there was placed a red-hot iron plate, which was pulled off after a moment and took with it the flesh of their chests.

Arabic: ثمَّ أُخِذَ البول والرماد فجُعِلَ على تلك الجراحات،
English: After that, urine and cinders were brought and put on these wounds,

Arabic: فأَقَرَّا على أنفسهما أنهما لم يقصدا إلَّا ما قاله السلطان،
English: whereupon they confessed that their intention had in fact been no other than as the Sultan had said,

Arabic: وأنهما مجرمان مستحقان للقتل فلا حق لهما ولا دعوى في دمائهما دنيا ولا أخرى،
English: and they were criminals and deserving of death, that there was nothing due to them as of right, nor any claim to retaliation for their blood whether by near relatives or others.

Arabic: وكتبا خطهما بذلك واعترفا به عند القاضي، فسَجَّلَ على العقد
English: They wrote all this down in their own handwriting, and testified to it before the qadI, who then set his seal upon the attestation.

Arabic: وكتب فيه أن اعترافهما كان عن غير إكراه ولا إجبار،
English: It was stated in the document that their confession had been made without compulsion or coercion,

Arabic: ولو قالا أُكْرِهْنَا لَعُذِّبَا أشد العذاب،
English: for if they had said that they had been forced to make a confession they would have been most severely tortured,

Arabic: ورأيا أن تعجيل ضَرْب العنق خير لهما من الموت بالعذاب الأليم،
English: and they held that a quick beheading was better for them than to die under painful torture.

Arabic: فقُتِلَا رحمهما الله تعالى.
English: So they were put to death, God Most High have mercy on them.

Arabic: ذكر قتله للشيخ هود
English: His killing of the shaikh Hud.

Arabic: وكان الشيخ زاده المسمى بهود حفيد الشيخ الصالح الولي ركن الدين بن بهاء الدين بن أبي زكرياء الملتاني،
English: The shaikh-zada named Hud was the grandson of the pious shaikh, the saintly Rukn al-DIn, son of Baha’ al-DIn ibn Abl Zakaruya of Multan, by his daughter.

Arabic: وجده الشيخ ركن الدين معظمًا عند السلطان،
English: His grandfather, the shaikh Rukn al-DIn, was held in high honour by the Sultan,

Arabic: وكذلك أخوه عماد الدين الذي كان شبيهًا بالسلطان وقتل قوم وقيعة كشلوخان وسنذكره،
English: as was also the latter’s brother ‘Imad al-DIn, who closely resembled the Sultan and was killed during the battle with Kishlu Khan, as we shall relate in due course.

Arabic: ولما قُتِلَ عماد الدين أعطى السلطان لأخيه ركن الدين مائة قرية ليأكل منها ويطعم الصادر والوارد بزاويته،
English: When ‘Imad al-DIn was killed, the Sultan gave his brother Rukn al-DIn a hundred villages, to use their revenues for his own maintenance and to supply food to wayfarers in his hospice [at Multan].

Arabic: فتوفي الشيخ ركن الدين وأوصى بمكانه من الزواية لحفيده الشيخ هود،
English: On the death of the shaikh Rukn al-DIn he had designated his grandson, the shaikh Hud, as his successor in [control of] the hospice,

Arabic: ونازَعَهُ في ذلك ابن أخي الشيخ ركن الدين وقال: أنا أحق بميراث عمي،
English: but his succession was contested by the son of the shaikh Rukn alDIn’s brother, who claimed that he had a prior right to inherit from his uncle.

Arabic: فقَدِمَا على السلطان وهو بدولة آباد وبينهما وبين ملتان ثمانون يومًا،
English: The two of them came before the Sultan while he was staying in Dawlat Abad (which is eighty days’ journey from Multan),

Arabic: فأعطى السلطان المشيخة لهود حسبما أوصى له الشيخ
English: and the Sultan assigned the shaikhly office to Hud, as the shaikh [Rukn al-DIn] had specified in his testament.

Arabic: وكان كهلًا، وكان ابن أخي الشيخ فتًى،
English: Hud was full age, whereas the shaikh’s nephew was but a young man;

Arabic: وأَكْرَمَه السلطان وأَمَرَ بتضييفه في كل منزل يدخله،
English: and the Sultan honoured him highly and gave orders that he should be treated as a guest in every station at which he should stop,

Arabic: وأن يخرج إلى لقائه أهل كل بلد يمر به إلى ملتان وتُصْنَع له فيه دعوة،
English: that the people of every town by which he passed should come out to receive him, and that a banquet should be prepared in it for him.

Arabic: فلما وَصَلَ الأمر للحضرة خرج الفقهاء والقضاة والمشايخ والأعيان للقائه،
English: When this order reached the capital, the jurists, qadIs, shaikhs and notables went out to receive him.

Arabic: وكنت فيمن خرج إليه
English: I was among those who did so.

Arabic: فتلقيناه وهو راكب في دولة يحملها الرجال وخيله مجنوبة،
English: When we met with him he was riding in a dula carried by men [on their shoulders], and his horses were being led.

Arabic: فسلمنا عليه وأنْكَرْتُ أنا ما كان من فعله في ركوبه الدولة، وقلت: إنما كان ينبغي له أن يركب الفرس ويساير من خرج للقائه من القضاة والمشايخ،
English: We saluted him, but for my part I resented this way of his of riding in a dula and said, ‘The only proper thing for him to do is to mount his horse and ride in alongside the qadIs and shaikhs who have come out to receive him.’

Arabic: فبلغه كلامي فركب الفرس
English: He was told what I had said and thereupon mounted his horse,

Arabic: واعتذر بأن فعله أوَّلًا كان بسبب أَلَمٍ مَنَعَهُ من ركوب الفرس،
English: making the excuse that his previous behaviour was due to some painful discomfort which had prevented him from riding.

Arabic: ودخل الحضرة وصُنِعَتْ له به دعوة أُنْفِقَ فيها من مال السلطان عدد كثير
English: On his entry into DihlI there was given in his honour a banquet which cost a pretty penny of the Sultan’s moneys,

Arabic: وحضر القضاة والمشايخ والفقهاء والأعزة
English: and was attended by the qadIs, shaikhs, jurists and distinguished foreigners.

Arabic: ومد السماط وأتوا بالطعام على العادة.
English: The repast was spread, and the dishes were brought in as usual,

Arabic: ثمَّ أُعْطِيَت الدراهم لكل من حضر على قدر استحقاقه،
English: after which gifts of money were made to all of those present, to each according to his worthiness.

Arabic: فأعطي قاضي القضاة خمسمائة دينار، وأُعْطِيتُ أنا مائتين وخمسين دينارًا
English: So the Grand QadI was given five hundred dinars, and I was given two hundred and fifty.

Arabic: وهذه عادة لهم في الدعوة السلطانية،
English: This is a regular custom of theirs on the occasion of a royal banquet.

Arabic: ثمَّ انصرف الشيخ هود إلى بلده
English: After this the shaikh Hud set out for his own country,

Arabic: ومعه الشيخ نور الدين الشيرازي بعثه السلطان ليجلسه على سجادة جده بزاويته،
English: accompanied by the shaikh Nur alDIn al-ShIrazI, whom the Sultan had sent to seat him on the prayer-mat of his grandfather in his hospice

Arabic: ويصنع له الدعوة من مال السلطان هنالك
English: and to arrange a banquet for him there at the Sultan’s expense.

Arabic: واستقرَّ بزاويته
English: After he had become established in his hospice

Arabic: وأقام بها أعوامًا،
English: and remained there for some years,

Arabic: ثمَّ إنَّ عماد الملك أمير بلاد السند كتب إلى السلطان يَذْكُر أن الشيخ وقرابته يشتغلون بجمع الأموال وإنفاقها في الشهوات، ولا يطعمون أحدًا بالزاوية،
English: the governor of Sind, ‘Imad alMulk, wrote to the Sultan stating that the shaikh and his relatives were devoting themselves to amassing riches and to spending them in the gratification of their carnal appetites, without supplying any food to anyone at the hospice.

Arabic: فنفد الأمر بمطالبتهم بالأموال،
English: The Sultan then sent an order to call them to account for the revenues [that had been assigned to Rukn alDln],

Arabic: فطلبهم عماد الملك بها وسجن بعضهم وضرب بعضًا،
English: whereupon ‘Imad al-Mulk demanded of them the restitution of the money, jailed some of them, and beat others.

Arabic: وصار يأخذ منهم كل يوم عشرين ألف دينار مدة أيام حتى استخلص ما كان عندهم
English: Every day for some length of time he extracted from them twenty thousand dinars, and eventually sequestrated everything that they had.

Arabic: ووجد لهم كثير من الأموال والذخائر،
English: There was found in their possession a great quantity of specie and treasures,

Arabic: من جملتها نعلان مرصعان بالجوهر والياقوت بيعا بسبعة آلاف دينار،
English: including two sandals encrusted with jewels and rubies, which were sold for seven thousand dinars.

Arabic: قيل: إنهما كانا لبنت الشيخ هود وقيل لسرية له،
English: Some said that they belonged to the shaikh Hud’s daughter, others that they belonged to a concubine that he had.

Arabic: فلما اشتدَّ الحال على الشيخ هرب يريد بلاد الأتراك، فقبض عليه
English: When the shaikh Hud was reduced to these straits, he fled, making for the land of the Turks, but was seized.

Arabic: وكتب عماد الملك بذلك إلى السلطان، فأمره أن يبعثه ويبعث الذي قبض عليه كلاهما في حكم الثقاف،
English: This was duly communicated by ‘Imad al-Mulk to the Sultan, who ordered him to despatch both the shaikh and his captor [to the capital] manacled like prisoners.

Arabic: فلما وصلا إليه سرح الذي قبض عليه وقال للشيخ هود أين أردت أن تفر؟
English: On their arrival he released the man who had arrested the Shaikh Hud, and said to the latter, ‘Where were you planning to escape to?’

Arabic: فاعتذر بعذر،
English: He made various efforts to excuse himself,

Arabic: فقال له السلطان إنما أردت أن تذهب إلى الأتراك فتقول أنا ابن الشيخ بهاء الدين زكرياء وقد فعل السلطان معي كذا وتأتي بهم لقتالنا، اضربوا عنقه،
English: but the Sultan said to him, ‘What you meant to do was to go to the Turks, and then you would say “I am the son of the shaikh Baha’ al-DIn Zakariya, and the Sultan has treated me in such and such a way,” and bring them to fight with us. Cut off his head.’

Arabic: فضُرِبَتْ عنقه رحمه الله تعالى.
English: So they beheaded him, God Most High have mercy on him.

Arabic: ذكر سَجْنه لابن تاج العارفين وقتله لأولاده
English: His imprisonment of Ibn Taj al-’Arifin and execution of his sons.

Arabic: وكان الشيخ الصالح شمس الدين ابن تاج العارفين ساكنًا بمدينة كول
English: The pious shaikh Shams al-DIn, son of Taj al-’ArifIn, lived in the city of Kuwil,

Arabic: منقطعًا للعبادة كبير القدر،
English: wholly occupied in religious exercises, and held in high respect.

Arabic: ودخل السلطان إلى مدينة كول، فبعث عنه
English: The Sultan, on entering the city of Kuwil [on one occasion] had sent for him,

Arabic: فلم يَأْتِهِ، فذهب السلطان إليه، ثم لما قارَبَ منزله انصرف ولم يَرَهُ،
English: but he refused to come to the Sultan, whereupon the Sultan went to visit him but after approaching his dwelling turned back without seeing him.

Arabic: واتفق بعد ذلك أن أميرًا من الأمراء خالَفَ على السلطان ببعض الجهات، وبايَعَهُ الناس،
English: Some time later, it happened that a certain amir rebelled against the Sultan in some district or other and received the allegiance of its people.

Arabic: فنُقِلَ للسلطان أنه وَقَعَ ذِكْر هذا الأمير بمجلس الشيخ شمس الدين
English: It came to the ears of the Sultan that some mention of that amir had been made in the shaikh Shams al-DIn’s assembly

Arabic: فأثنى عليه وقال: إنه يَصْلُح للمُلْك،
English: and that the shaikh had commended him and said that he possessed the qualities which befit a king.

Arabic: فبعث السلطان بعض الأمراء إلى الشيخ
English: Thereupon the Sultan sent one of the amIrs to [fetch] the shaikh.

Arabic: فقَيَّدَه وقَيَّد أولاده وقَيَّد قاضي كول ومحتسبها؛
English: This officer put fetters on the shaikh and on his sons, as well as on the qadi and muhtasib of Kuwil,

Arabic: لأنه ذُكِرَ أنهما كانا حاضرَيْن للمجلس الذي وَقَعَ فيه ثناء الشيخ على الأمير المخالِف،
English: because it was reported that both of them had been present at the assembly in which the incident of the shaikh’s praise of the rebel amir had occurred.

Arabic: وأمر بهم فسُجِنُوا جميعًا بعد أن سَمَلَ عيني القاضي وعيني المحتسب،
English: [The Sultan] gave orders that they should all be gaoled, after first blinding both the qadi and the muhtasib.

Arabic: ومات الشيخ بالسجن،
English: The shaikh died in the prison;

Arabic: وكان القاضي والمحتسب يخرجان مع بعض السجانين، فيسألان الناس،
English: the qadi and muhtasib used to be brought out under charge of one of the gaolers and to beg for alms from the townsfolk,

Arabic: ثم يُرَدَّان إلى السجن،
English: and would then be taken back to the prison.

Arabic: وكان قد بلغ السلطان أن أولاد الشيخ كانوا يخالطون كفار الهنود وعصاتهم ويصحبونهم،
English: The Sultan had been informed that the shaikh’s sons used to be on friendly terms with the Hindu infidels and rebels and to consort with them.

Arabic: فلما مات أبوهم أَخْرَجَهُم من السجن، وقال لهم: لا تعودوا إلى ما كنتم تفعلون،
English: When their father died, he released them from the prison and said to them ‘Take care not to return to what you used to do.’

Arabic: فقالوا له: وما فَعَلْنا؟
English: They replied to him ‘And what was it we did?,’

Arabic: فاغتاظ من ذلك، وأَمَرَ بقتلهم جميعًا فقُتِلُوا،
English: upon which he was infuriated and ordered them both to be executed, and executed they were.

Arabic: ثم استحضر القاضي المذكور فقال: أخبرني بمن كان يرى رأي هؤلاء الذين قُتِلُوا ويفعل مثل أفعالهم،
English: He then summoned the qadi of whom we have spoken and said, ‘Tell me who used to share the views of these men who have been executed and to act in the same way.’

Arabic: فأملى أسماء رجال كثيرين من كفار البلد،
English: The qadi dictated the names of numerous persons among the notables of the region,

Arabic: فلما عرض ما أملاه على السلطان قال: هذا يحب أن يخرب البلد، اضْرِبُوا عنقه
English: but when the Sultan was presented with his list he said ‘This fellow wants the country to go to ruin. Cut off his head.’

Arabic: فضُرِبَت عنقه رحمه الله تعالى.
English: So he was beheaded, God Most High have mercy on him.

Arabic: ذكر قتله للشيخ الحيدري
English: The execution of the shaikh ai-Haidari.

Arabic: وكان الشيخ علي الحيدري ساكنًا بمدينة كنباية من ساحل الهند،
English: The shaikh ‘All al-HaidarI used to live in the city of Kanbaya [Cambay], on the coast of India.

Arabic: وهو عظيم الْقَدْر شهير الذِّكْر بَعِيد الصيت
English: He was held in high respect, well spoken of, and of wide reputation.

Arabic: ينذر له التجار بالبحر النذور الكثيرة، وإذا قدموا بدءوا بالسلام عليه،
English: The sea-traders used to vow to give large sums to him, and on arriving [in Cambay] they would go first of all to salute him.

Arabic: وكان يكاشف بأحوالهم،
English: He would show them that he knew what was in their minds;

Arabic: وربما نذر أحدهم النذر وندم عليه،
English: often one of them would make a vow and then repent of it,

Arabic: فإذا أتى الشيخ للسلام عليه أَعْلَمَهُ بما نذر له وأمر بالوفاء به،
English: but when he came to salute the shaikh, the shaikh would tell him first how much he had vowed and order him to fulfil it faithfully.

Arabic: واتفق له ذلك مرات واشتهر به،
English: He was successful in this sort of thing many times, and became renowned for it.

Arabic: فلما خالف القاضي جلال الأفغاني وقبيلته بتلك الجهات
English: When the qadI Jalal al-DIn al-AfghanI and his tribesmen revolted in those parts,

Arabic: بلغ السلطان أن الشيخ الحيدري دعا للقاضي جلال الدين وأعطاه شاشيته من رأسه،
English: it was reported to the Sultan that the shaikh al-HaidarI had prayed for the qadI Jalal and had taken off his own cap and given it to him,

Arabic: وذكر أيضًا أنه بايعه،
English: and it was alleged that he had even sworn allegiance to him.

Arabic: فلما خرج السلطان إليهم بنفسه
English: So the Sultan, when he went out in person to deal with them,

Arabic: وانهزم القاضي جلال خلف السلطان شرف الملك أمير بخت أحد الوافدين معنا عليه بكنباية،
English: and the qadI Jalal had taken flight, appointed as his representative in Kanbaya Sharaf al-Mulk Amir Bakht, one of those who had come to his court along with us,

Arabic: وأمره بالبحث عن أهل الخلاف،
English: with orders to search out those involved in the rebellion.

Arabic: وجعل معه فقهاء يحكم بقولهم
English: He associated also a number of jurists with him, on whose advice he was to pass judgement.

Arabic: فأحضر الشيخ علي الحيدري بين يديه،
English: The shaikh ‘All al-HaidarI having been brought for trial before Sharaf alMulk,

Arabic: وثبت أنه أعطى للقائم شاشيته ودعا له، فحكموا بقتله،
English: it was established that he had given the rebel his cap and had prayed for him, and they condemned him to death.

Arabic: فلما ضربه السياف لم يفعل شيئًا،
English: When the swordsman struck him, however, he produced no effect.

Arabic: وعجب الناس لذلك وظنوا أنه يعفي عنه بسبب ذلك،
English: The people marvelled at this, and imagined that he would be granted a pardon because of it;

Arabic: فأمر سيافًا آخر بضَرْب عنقه فضَرَبها رحمه الله تعالى.
English: but Sharaf al-Mulk ordered another swordsman to behead him, and he did so—God Most High have mercy on him.

Arabic: ذكر قتله لطوغان وأخيه
English: His execution of Tughan and his brother.

Arabic: وكان طوغان الفرغاني وأخوه من كبار أهل مدينة فرغانة،
English: Tughan al-Farghani and his brother were of a family of notables in the city of Farghana.

Arabic: فوفدا على السلطان فأحسن إليهما، وأعطاهما عطاء جزيلًا، وأقاما عنده مدة،
English: They had come to the Sultan’s court, had been generously received by him and given a handsome revenue, and remained with him for some time.

Arabic: فلما طال مقامهما أرادا الرجوع إلى بلادهما، وحاولا الفرار
English: When their residence [in DihlI] lengthened out, they wished to return to their own land and planned to take flight.

Arabic: فوشي بهما أحد أصحابهما إلى السلطان،
English: Their design was denounced to the Sultan by one of their companions;

Arabic: فأمر بتوسيطهما فوسطا، وأعطي للذي وشى بهما جميع ما لهما،
English: he ordered them to be cut in halves (as was duly done), and gave to the informer who had revealed their plan all of their possessions.

Arabic: وكذلك عادتهم بتلك البلاد إذا وشى أحد بأحد وثبت ما وشى به
English: Such is their custom in that country— when one person informs against another, and the substance of his accusation is proved,

Arabic: فقتل أعطي ماله.
English: so that the accused person is executed, then he is given the property of the latter.

Arabic: ذكر قتله لابن ملك التجار
English: His execution of the son of the Maiik of the Merchants.

Arabic: وكان ابن ملك التجار شابًّا صغير الإنبات بعارضيه،
English: The son of the Malik of the Merchants was a very young man, with no hair as yet on his cheeks.

Arabic: فلما وَقَعَ خلاف عين الملك وقيامه وقتاله للسلطان كما سنذكره غلب على ابن ملك التجَّار هذا،
English: When the rebellion and rising of ‘Ain al-Mulk occurred, and [led to] his warfare with the Sultan, as we shall relate, he seized this son of the Malik of the Merchants.

Arabic: فكان في جملته مقهورًا،
English: The boy was thus included in the rebel forces against his will.

Arabic: فلما هزم عين الملك وقبض عليه وعلى أصحابه، كان من جملتهم ابن ملك التجار وصهره ابن قطب الملك،
English: Upon the defeat of ‘Ain al-Mulk and the capture of both him and his supporters, the son of the Malik al-Tujjar and his brother-in-law Ibn Qutb al-Mulk were amongst the captives,

Arabic: فأمر بهما فعلقا من أيديهما في خشب، وأمر أبناء الملوك فرموهما بالنشاب حتى ماتا،
English: and on the Sultan’s orders they were strung up by the hands to a wooden stake and the sons of the maliks shot arrows at them until they died.

Arabic: ولما ماتا قال الحاجب خواجة أمير علي التبريزي لقاضي القضاة كمال الدين: ذلك الشاب لم يجب عليه القتل،
English: After their death the chamberlain Khwaja Amir ‘All al-TibrIzI said to the Grand QadI Kamal al-DIn ‘That youth should not have been killed.’

Arabic: فبلغ ذلك السلطان فقال: هلا قلت هذا قبل موته،
English: His words were reported to the Sultan, who said, ‘Why did you not say so before his death?’,

Arabic: وأمر به فضرب مائتي مقرعة أو نحوها، وسجن
English: and ordered him to be given two hundred or so lashes with the whip and to be cast into prison.

Arabic: وأعطي جميع ماله لأمير السيافين،
English: All of his possessions were given to the amir of the swordsmen.

Arabic: فرأيته في ثاني ذلك اليوم قد لبس ثيابه، وجعل قلنسوته على رأسه، وركب فرسه، فظننت أنه هو،
English: I saw this man on the following day dressed in the garments of the Khwaja Amir ‘All, wearing his high bonnet, and riding his horse, and took him to be the Khwaja himself.

Arabic: وأقام بالسجن شهورًا ثمَّ سرحه، وردَّه إلى ما كان عليه
English: He meanwhile remained in prison for some months, after which the Sultan released him and restored him to his former post.

Arabic: ثم غضب عليه ثانية، ونفاه إلى خراسان فاستقر بهراة، وكتب إليه يستعطفه،
English: Later on, he again incurred the Sultan’s wrath and was banished to Khurasan, where he settled in Harat, and wrote to the Sultan to beg his mercy.

Arabic: فوقع له على ظهر كتابع أكربار آمدي باز (أي) معناه: إن كُنْتَ تُبْتَ فارجع،
English: The Sultan endorsed the letter in his favour [and returned it to him with the following words written] on its back, Eger baz amadi baz [ay], which mean ‘If you have repented, come back.’

Arabic: فرجع إليه.
English: So then he returned to his service.

Arabic: ذكر ضربه لخطيب الخطباء حتى مات
English: His beating to death of the chief Khatib.

Arabic: وكان قد ولي خطيب الخطباء بدهلي النظر في خزانة الجواهر في السفر،
English: The Sultan had placed the treasury which contained the jewels during his travels under the guardianship of the chief Khatib of Dihli.

Arabic: فاتفق أن جاء سراق الكفار ليلًا، فضربوا على تلك الخزانة، وذهبوا بشيء منها،
English: It befel that some infidel thieves came by night, made for this treasury, and went off with part of its contents.

Arabic: فأمر بضرب الخطيب حتى مات رحمه الله تعالى.
English: Whereupon the Sultan commanded the Khatib to be beaten until he died —God Most High have mercy on him.

Arabic: ذكر تخريبه لدهلي ونفي أهلها وقتل الأعمى والمقعد
English: His devastation of Dihli and exile of its population, and killing of the blind man and the cripple.

Arabic: ومن أعظم ما كان يُنْقَم على السلطان إجلاؤه لأهل دهلي عنها،
English: One of the gravest charges against the Sultan is his forcing of the population of Dihli to evacuate the city.

Arabic: وسبب ذلك أنهم كانوا يكتبون بطائق فيها شتمه وسبه، ويختمون عليها،
English: The reason for this is that they used to write missives reviling and insulting him, seal them,

Arabic: ويكتبون عليها وحق رأس خوند عالم ما يقرؤها غيره،
English: and inscribe them, ‘By the head of the Master of the World, none but he may read this.’

Arabic: ويرمونها بالمشور ليلًا، فإذا فضها وجد فيها شتمه وسبه،
English: Then they would throw them into the audience-hall by night, and when the Sultan broke the seal he found them full of insults and abuse of him.

Arabic: فعزم على تخريب دهلي، واشترى من أهلها جميعًا دورهم ومنازلهم، ودفع لهم ثمنها،
English: So he decided to lay Dihli in ruins, and having bought from all the inhabitants their houses and dwellings and paid their price to them,

Arabic: وأَمَرَهُم بالانتقال عنها إلى دولة آباد
English: he commanded them to move out of the city and go to Dawlat Abad.

Arabic: فأبوا ذلك، فنادى مناديه ألَّا يبقى بها أحد بعد ثلاث،
English: They refused, so his herald was sent to proclaim that no person should remain in it after three nights.

Arabic: فانتقل معظمهم، واختفى بعضهم في الدور،
English: The majority of the citizens left, but some of them hid in the houses.

Arabic: فأمر بالبحث عمن بَقِيَ بها، فوجد عبيدُه بأزقتها رَجُلَيْن؛
English: The Sultan ordered a search to be made for any persons who had remained in the city, and his slaves found two men in its streets,

Arabic: أحدهما مقعد والآخر أعمى،
English: one of them a cripple and the other blind.

Arabic: فأتوا بهما فأَمَرَ بالمقعد فرُمِيَ به في المنجنيق، وأمر أن يُجَرَّ الأعمى من دهلي إلى دولة آباد مسيرة أربعين يومًا،
English: They were brought in, and he ordered that the cripple should be flung from a mangonel and the blind man dragged from Dihli to Dawlat Abad, a distance of forty days’ journey.

Arabic: فتمزق في الطريق ووصل منه رِجْله،
English: He fell to pieces on the road, and all of him that reached Dawlat Abad was his leg.

Arabic: ولما فعل ذلك خرج أهلها جميعًا، وتركوا أثقالهم وأمتعتهم،
English: After this action on the part of the Sultan, the whole of the population left the town, abandoning furniture and possessions,

Arabic: وبقيت المدينة خاوية على عروشها،
English: and the city was left desolate and disintegrating.

Arabic: فحدَّثَني من أَثِقُ به قال صعد السلطان ليلة إلى سطح قصره،
English: A person in whom I have confidence told me that the Sultan mounted one night to the roof of his palace

Arabic: فنظر إلى دهلي، وليس بها نار ولا دخان ولا سراح، فقال: الآن طاب قلبي وتهدن خاطري،
English: and looked out over Dihli, where there was neither fire nor smoke nor lamp, and said ‘Now my mind is tranquil and my feelings are appeased.’

Arabic: ثم كتب إلى أهل البلاد أن ينتقلوا إلى دهلي ليعمروها،
English: Afterwards he wrote to the inhabitants of the provinces commanding them to move to Dihli, in order to repopulate it.

Arabic: فخربت بلادهم، ولم تعمر دهلي لاتساعها وضخامتها وهي من أعظم مدن الدنيا،
English: The result was that their cities were ruined but Dihli remained unrestored, because of its extent and immensity, for it is one of the greatest cities in the world.

Arabic: وكذلك وجدناها لما دخلنا إليها خالية ليس بها إلا قليل عمارة،
English: It was in this condition that we found it on our entry into it, empty and unpopulated save for a few inhabitants.

Arabic: وقد ذكرنا كثيرًا من مآثر هذا السلطان ومما نقم عليه أيضًا
English: As we have now related many of the generous qualities of this Sultan, as well as the crimes with which he was charged,

Arabic: فلنذكر جملًا من الوقائع والحوادث الكائنة في أيامه.
English: we shall proceed to give summary accounts of the military and political events which occurred in his time.

Arabic: ذكر ما افتتح به أمره أول ولايته من منة على بهادور بورة
English: His inauguration of his reign by pardoning Bahadur Bura.

Arabic: ولما ولي السلطان الملك بعد أبيه وبايَعَه الناس
English: When the Sultan took possession of the kingdom after his father’s death and the people had taken the oath of allegiance to him,

Arabic: أحضر السلطان غياث الدين بهادور بورة، الذي كان أسره السلطان تغلق
English: he summoned the sultan Ghiyath al-DIn Bahadur Bura, who had been taken prisoner by the Sultan Tughluq,

Arabic: فمَنَّ عليه وفَكَّ قيوده وأَجْزَلَهُ العطاء من الأموال والخيل والفيلة، وصرفه إلى مملكته،
English: and having pardoned him and loosed him from his chains, he made him a munificent gift of money, horses and elephants, and restored him to his kingdom.

Arabic: وبعث معه ابن أخيه إبراهيم خان، وعاهَدَهُ على أن تكون تلك المملكة مشاطرة بينهما،
English: He sent along with him his brother’s son Bahram Khan and swore him to an agreement that that kingdom should be divided equally between them,

Arabic: وتُكْتَب أسماؤهما معًا في السكة ويُخْطَب لهما،
English: both their names should be inscribed on the coinage and mentioned in the khutba,

Arabic: وعلى أن يصرف غياث الدين ابنه محمد المعروف برباط يكون رهينة عند السلطان،
English: and that Ghiyath al-DIn should send his son Muhammad, known as Barbat, to be a hostage with the Sultan.

Arabic: فانصرف غياث الدين إلى مملكته، والتزم ما شرط عليه، إلا أنه لم يبعث ابنه،
English: Ghiyath al-DIn returned to his kingdom and undertook to carry out all these stipulations, but he did not send his son,

Arabic: وادعى أنه امتنع وأساء الأدب في كلامه،
English: on the pretext that he refused to go, and he used unseemly expressions in his discourse.

Arabic: فبعث السلطان العساكر إلى ابن أخيه إبراهيم خان وأميرهم دلجلي التتري،
English: The Sultan consequently sent troops to his brother’s son Bahram Khan, under the command of DulgI the Tatar,

Arabic: فقاتلوا غياث الدين فقتلوه، وسلخوا جلده، وحشي بالتبن، وطِيفَ به على البلاد.
English: and they fought against Ghiyath al-DIn, killed him and stripped off his skin and having stuffed it with straw sent it on tour round the provinces.

Arabic: ذكر ثورة ابن عمته وما اتصل بذلك
English: The revolt of the son of his father’s sister and the events connected with it.

Arabic: وكان للسلطان تغلق ابن أخت يُسمَّى بهاء الدين كشت أسب (بضم الكاف وسكون الشين المعجم وتاء معلوَّة)، وأسب (بالسين المهمل والباء الموحدة مسكنين)، فجعله أميرًا ببعض النواحي،
English: Sultan Tughluq had a sister’s son called Baha al-DIn Kusht-Asb, whom he appointed governor of one of the provinces.

Arabic: فلما مات خاله امتنع من بيعة ابنه وكان شجاعًا بطلًا،
English: This man, who was brave and warlike, refused to take the oath of allegiance to the son of Tughluq after his uncle’s death,

Arabic: فبعث السلطان إليه العساكر، فيهم الأمراء الكبار مثل الملك مجير،
English: and the Sultan sent troops against him, amongst whom were the principal amIrs such as the malik MujIr,

Arabic: والوزير خواجة جهان أمير على الجمع،
English: the vizier Khwaja Jahan being in command of the whole expedition.

Arabic: فالْتَقَى الفرسان، واشتد القتال،
English: When the horsemen engaged one another a fierce battle ensued,

Arabic: وصَبَرَ كِلَا الْعَسْكَرَيْنِ،
English: each of the two armies holding its ground,

Arabic: ثم كانت الْكَرَّة لعسكر السلطان، ففر بهاء الدين إلى ملك من ملوك الكفار يُعرف بالراي كنبيلة،
English: until finally the victory was won by the Sultan’s troops and Baha al-DIn fled to one of the kings of the infidels called Ray KanbIla.

Arabic: والراي عندهم كمثل ما هو بلسان الروم عبارة عن السلطان
English: Ray is with them, just as it is in the language of the Franks, a word which means Sultan,

Arabic: وكنبيلة اسم الإقليم الذي هو به وهو (بفتح الكاف وسكون النون وكسر الباء الموحدة وياء ولام مفتوح)،
English: and KanbIla is the name of the region where this prince lived.

Arabic: وهذا الراي له بلاد في جبال منيعة، وهو من أكابر سلاطين الكفار،
English: This Ray had territories situated in inaccessible mountains and was one of the principal Sultans of the infidels.

Arabic: فلما هرب إليه بهاء الدين اتبعته عساكر السلطان، وحصروا تلك البلاد،
English: When Baha al-DIn fled to him he was followed up by the Sultan’s armies, who surrounded those territories.

Arabic: واشتد الأمر على الكافر، ونفد ما عنده من الزرع،
English: The situation became critical for the infidel and all the grain which he had was exhausted.

Arabic: وخاف أن يؤخذ باليد، فقال لبهاء الدين: إن الحال قد بلغت لما تراه،
English: Fearing that he should be taken by force he said to Baha al-DIn ‘Matters have reached the pass which you see,

Arabic: وأنا عازم على هلاك نفسي وعيالي ومن تبعني،
English: and I am determined to destroy myself and my family and all those who follow me.

Arabic: فاذهب أنت إلى السلطان فلان — لسلطان من الكفار سماه له — فأقم عنده فإنه سيمنعك،
English: Do you go to Sultan so-and-so (mentioning a certain Sultan of the infidels) and remain with him, for he will protect you’.

Arabic: وبعث معه من أوصله إليه،
English: Having sent him with someone to conduct him to the Sultan,

Arabic: وأمر راي كنبيلة بنار عظيمة فأججت وأحرق فيها أمتعته،
English: Ray KanbIla ordered a great fire to be lit, burnt all his possessions in it

Arabic: وقال لنسائه وبناته أني أريد قتل نفسي، فمن أرادت موافقتي فلتفعل،
English: and said to his wives and daughters ‘I intend to kill myself and any of you who wish to follow my example, let her do so.’

Arabic: فكانت المرأة منهن تَغْتَسِل وتدهن بالصندل والمقاصري،
English: So every woman amongst them bathed herself, perfumed herself with yellow sandal-wood,

Arabic: وتُقَبِّل الأرض بين يديه، وترمي بنفسها في النار حتى هلكن جميعًا.
English: kissed the ground before him and threw herself into the fire, until they perished to the last one.

Arabic: وفَعَلَ مثل ذلك نساء أمرائه ووزرائه وأرباب دولته ومن أراد من سائر النساء،
English: The same was done by the female relatives of his amirs and viziers and chief officers; and all other women who wished to follow their example.

Arabic: ثم اغتسل الراي وأدهن بالصندل، ولبس السلاح ما عدا الدرع،
English: The Ray then bathed himself, perfumed himself with sandal and put on his armour except for the breast plate.

Arabic: وفعل كفعله من أراد الموت معه من ناسه،
English: The same was done by all those of his men who wished to die with him,

Arabic: وخرجوا إلى عسكر السلطان فقاتلوا حتى قتلوا جميعًا،
English: and they went out to meet the Sultan’s army and fought until they were killed to the last man.

Arabic: ودخلت المدينة فأسر أهلها وأسر من أولاد راي كنبيلة أحد عشر ولدًا، فأتى بهم السلطان
English: The city was entered and its population taken prisoner, together with eleven of the sons of Ray Kanbila, who were brought before the Sultan.

Arabic: فأسلموا جميعًا، وجعلهم السلطان أمراء، وعظماء لأصالتهم ولفعل أبيهم،
English: They all accepted Islam and the Sultan made them amirs and honoured them greatly owing to their noble lineage and their father’s action.

Arabic: فرأيت عنده منهم نصرًا وبختيار والمهردار وهو صاحب الخاتم الذي يختم به على الماء الذي يشرب السلطان ومنه
English: I saw in his entourage three of these princes, Nasr, Bakhtiyar, and the muhurdar, i.e. the keeper of the seal with which the water which the Sultan drinks is sealed;

Arabic: وكنيته أبو مسلم وكانت بيني وبينه صحبة ومودة،
English: his name of address is Abu Muslim and he and I became companions and friends.

Arabic: ولما قتل رأى كنبيلة توجهت عساكر السلطان إلى بلد الطفار الذي لجأ إليه بهاء الدين وأحاطوا به،
English: When Ray Kanbila was killed the Sultan’s troops made towards the city of the infidel with whom Baha al-Din had taken refuge and surrounded it.

Arabic: فقال ذلك السلطان: أنا لا أقدر على أن أفعل ما فعله راي كنبيلة، فقبض على بهاء الدين، وأسلمه إلى عسكر السلطان، فقيدوه وغلوه وأتوا به،
English: This Sultan said I cannot do what Ray Kanbila did,’ so he arrested Baha al-Din and delivered him to the Sultan’s troops, who bound him with chains and manacles and brought him to the Sultan.

Arabic: فلما أتي به إليه أمر بإدخاله إلى قرابته من النساء فشتمنه وبصقن في وجهه،
English: When he was brought before him he ordered him to be taken into the apartments of his female relatives, who showered abuse on him and spat in his face.

Arabic: وأمر بسلخه وهو بقيد الحياة فسلخ وطبخ لحمه مع الأرز وبعث لأولاده وأهله،
English: The Sultan then ordered him to be flayed alive, and when he had been flayed his flesh was cooked with rice and sent to his sons and his family.

Arabic: وجعل باقيه على صحفة، وطرح للفيلة لتأكله فأبت أكله،
English: The remains of him were put in a platter and thrown to the elephants to eat, but they would not eat it.

Arabic: وأمر بجلده فحُشِيَ بالتبن وقُرِنَ بجلد بهادور بورة
English: On the Sultan’s orders his skin was stuffed with straw and, in conjunction with the skin of Bahadur Bura,

Arabic: وطِيفَ بهما على البلاد،
English: was exhibited in all the provinces in turn.

Arabic: فلما وصلا إلى بلاد السند
English: When they arrived in the province of Sind,

Arabic: وأمير أمرائها يومئذٍ كشلوخان
English: the ruling amir there at that time being Kishlu Khan,

Arabic: صاحب السلطان تغلق ومعينه على أَخْذ الملك،
English: the companion of the Sultan Tughluq (he had assisted him to seize the kingdom,

Arabic: وكان السلطان يعظمه ويخاطبه بالعم
English: and Sultan Muhammad used to show him respect and address him as uncle,

Arabic: ويخرج لاستقباله إذا وَفَدَ من بلاده،
English: and go out to meet him when he came from his territories to visit him),

Arabic: أَمَرَ كشلوخان بدفن الجلدين،
English: Kishlu Khan gave orders to bury the two skins.

Arabic: فبلغ ذلك السلطان، فشق عليه فِعْلُه وأراد الفتك به.
English: When the Sultan learnt of this he was angered by what he had done and determined to put him to death.

Arabic: ذكر ثورة كشلوخان وقتله
English: The rising and death of Kishlu Khan.

Arabic: ولما اتصل بالسلطان ما كان مِنْ فِعْلِه في دَفْن الجلدين بَعَثَ عنه
English: When the Sultan learnt of his action in burying the two skins he sent for him,

Arabic: وعلم كشلوخان أنه يريد عقابه، فامتنع وخالَفَ
English: and Kishlu Khan, realising that he intended to punish him, refused to go and rose in revolt.

Arabic: وأعطى الأموال وجمع العساكر،
English: He distributed the revenues and assembled troops;

Arabic: وبعث إلى الترك والأفغان وأهل خراسان،
English: he sent to the Turks, and the Afghans, and the men of Khurasan,

Arabic: فأتاه منهم العدد الجم حتى كافأ عسكره عسكر السلطان، أو أربى عليه كثرة،
English: and was joined by such large numbers of them that his army equalled that of the Sultan or even exceeded it in size.

Arabic: وخرج السلطان بنفسه لقتاله، فكان اللقاء على مسيرة يومين من ملتان بصحراء أبوهر،
English: The Sultan went out in person to engage him and when the battle took place at a distance of two days’ journey from Multan, in the plain of Abuhar,

Arabic: وأخذ السلطان بالحزم عند لقائه، فجعل تحت الشطر عوضًا منه الشيخ عماد الدين شقيق الشيخ ركن الدين الملتان، وهو حدثني هذا وكان شبيهًا به،
English: he adopted a prudent measure and set in his place beneath the parasol the Shaikh ‘Imad al-Din, the brother of the Shaikh Rukn al-Din of Multan (it was the latter who told me this), since he closely resembled him.

Arabic: فلما حمى القتال انفرد السلطان في أربعة آلاف من عسكره،
English: When the battle grew hot the Sultan detached himself with, of his troops,

Arabic: وقصد عسكر كشلوخان قصد الشطر معتقدين أن السلطان تحته فقتلوا عماد الدين،
English: while those of Kishlu Khan made for the parasol in the belief that the Sultan was underneath it and killed ‘Imad al-Din.

Arabic: وشاع في العسكر أن السلطان قُتِلَ
English: The report spread amongst the troops that the Sultan had been killed,

Arabic: فاشتغلت عساكر كشلوخان بالنهب، وتفرقوا عنه،
English: whereupon Kishlu Khan’s men busied themselves with plundering and became separated from him.

Arabic: ولم يَبْقَ معه إلا القليل،
English: When none remained with him but a few,

Arabic: فقصده السلطان بمن معه
English: the Sultan attacked him with the troops that had withdrawn with him,

Arabic: فقتله وجز رأسه،
English: killed him and cut off his head.

Arabic: وعلم بذلك جيشه ففروا ودخل السلطان مدينة ملتان
English: When his army learnt of this they fled and the Sultan entered the city of Multan.

Arabic: وقبض على قاضيها كريم الدين، وأمر بسلخه فسلخ،
English: He arrested its qadI Karim al-DIn and ordered him to be flayed, which was done,

Arabic: وأمر برأس كشلوخان فعلق على بابه،
English: and ordered Kishlu Khan’s head to be set over its gate,

Arabic: وقد رأيته معلقًا لما وصلت إلى ملتان،
English: and I myself saw it there when I arrived at Multan.

Arabic: وأعطى السلطان للشيخ ركن الدين أخي عماد الدين ولابنه صدر الدين مائة قرية
English: The Sultan gave to the Shaikh Rukn al-DIn, the brother of ‘Imad al-DIn, and to ‘Imad al-DIn’s son Sadr al-DIn a hundred villages,

Arabic: إنعامًا عليهم ليأكلوا منها، ويطعموا بزاويتهم
English: as a gift to them for their own consumption and to supply food [to travellers] in their hospice,

Arabic: المنسوبة لجدهم بهاء الدين زكريا،
English: which is called by the name of their grandfather Baha al-DIn ZakarIya.

Arabic: وأمر السلطان وزيره خواجة جهان أن يذهب إلى مدينة كمال بور،
English: The Sultan commanded his vizier Khwaja Jahan to go to the city of Kamalpur,

Arabic: وهي مدينة كبيرة على ساحل البحر، وكان أهلها قد خالفوا،
English: which is a large city on the sea coast, whose inhabitants had revolted.

Arabic: فأخبرني بعض الفقهاء أنه حضر دخول الوزير إياها،
English: A certain doctor of the law told me that he was present when the vizier entered the city.

Arabic: قال: وأحضر بين يديه القاضي بها والخطيب، فأمر بسلخ جلودهما
English: He said ‘He had brought before him the qadI there and the khatIb and gave orders that they should be flayed.

Arabic: فقال له: اقتلنا بغير ذلك،
English: They said to him “Put us to death without this.”

Arabic: فقال لهما: بما استوجبتما القتل؟
English: He said to them “For what reason have you deserved to be put to death?”

Arabic: فقالا: بمخالفتنا أمر السلطان،
English: They replied “For our disobedience to the Sultan’s commands.”

Arabic: فقال لهما: فكيف أخالف أنا أمره، وقد أمرني أن أقتلكما بهذه القتلة؟
English: Whereupon he said to them “Then why should I disobey his command when he has ordered me to put you to death this way?”

Arabic: وقال للمتولين لسلخهما: احفروا لهما حفرًا تحت وجوههما يتنفسان فيها،
English: Then he said to those responsible for flaying them “Dig out hollows for them under their faces so that they may breathe,”

Arabic: فإنهم إذا سلخوا والعياذ بالله يطرحون على وجوههم،
English: because when men are flayed (God preserve us) they are laid down on their faces.

Arabic: ولما فعل ذلك تمهدت بلاد السند، وعاد السلطان إلى حضرته.
English: After all this was done the province of Sind was pacified and the Sultan returned to his capital.

Arabic: ذكر الوقيعة بجبل قراجيل على جيش السلطان(وأول اسمه قاف وجيم معقودة)،
English: Account of the defeat suffered by the Sultan’s army in the mountain of Qaracil.

Arabic: وجبل قراجيل هذا جبل كبير يتصل مسيرة ثلاثة أشهر
English: This is a great range of mountains extending for a distance of three months’ journey,

Arabic: وبينه وبين دهلي مسيرة عشر،
English: and ten days’ journey from DihlI,

Arabic: وسلطانه من أكبر سلاطين الكفار،
English: and its Sultan is one of the most powerful sultans of the infidels.

Arabic: وكان السلطان بعث ملك نكبية رأس الدويدارية إلى حرب هذا الجبل
English: The Sultan [Muhammad] had sent Malik Nukbiya, the chief of the dawIdars, to war against these mountains,

Arabic: ومعه مائة ألف فارس ورجالة سواهم كثير،
English: with an army of 100,000 horsemen and many infantry in addition.

Arabic: فملك مدينة جديدة (وضبطها بكسر الجيم وسكون الدال المهمل وفتح الياء آخر الحروف)، وهي أسفل الجبل
English: He occupied the town of Jidya, which lies at the foot of the mountain,

Arabic: وملك ما يليها وسبى وخرب وأحرق،
English: and seized the neighbouring regions, taking prisoners, destroying and burning.

Arabic: وفر الكفار إلى أعلى الجبل، وتركوا بلادهم وأموالهم وخزائن ملكهم،
English: The infidels fled to the upper part of the mountain, abandoning their lands and possessions and the treasuries of their king.

Arabic: وللجبل طريق واحد
English: There is only one road to this mountain;

Arabic: وعن أسفل منه وادٍ وفوقه الجبل، فلا يجوز فيه إلا فارِسٌ منفرد خلفه آخر،
English: below it there is a valley and above it the mountain itself and it cannot be used except by single horsemen in file.

Arabic: فصعدت عساكر المسلمين على ذلك الطريق وتملكوا مدينة ورنكل
English: The Muslim troops climbed up along this road and took possession of the town of Warangal,

Arabic: التي بأعلى الجبل (وضبطها بفتح الواو والراء وسكون النون وفتح الكاف)، واحتووا على ما فيها،
English: which is on the upper part of the mountain, and seized all that it contained.

Arabic: وكتبوا إلى السلطان بالفتح
English: On their informing the Sultan of their victory by letter,

Arabic: فبعث إليهم قاضيًا وخطيبًا وأمرهم بالإقامة،
English: he sent a qadI and a khatIb to them, together with orders to them to remain there.

Arabic: فلما كان وقت نزول المطر غلب المرض على العسكر،
English: But when the rainy season began there was an epidemic in the army;

Arabic: وضعفوا وماتت الخيل وانحلت القِسِيُّ،
English: the troops were enfeebled, the horses died, and the bows became slack.

Arabic: فكتب الأمراء إلى السلطان، واستأذنوه في الخروج عن الجبل
English: Thereupon the amIrs wrote to the Sultan asking his permission to leave the mountain

Arabic: والنزول إلى أسفله بخلال ما ينصرم فصل نزول المطر فيعودون،
English: and to descend to the foot of it until the end of the rainy season, when they would go back again.

Arabic: فأذن لهم في ذلك، فأخذ الأمير نكبية الأموال التي استولى عليها من الخزائن والمعادن
English: On receiving his permission to do that, the amIr Nukbiya took the goods which he had captured from the treasuries and the precious metals

Arabic: وفرقها على الناس ليرفعوها ويوصلوها إلى أسفل الجبل،
English: and distributed them amongst the troops to carry them and bring them down to the bottom of the mountain.

Arabic: فعندما علم الكفار بخروجهم قعدوا لهم بتلك المهاوي، وأخذوا عليها المضيق،
English: As soon as the infidels learnt of their withdrawal they lay in wait for them at those precipitous places and held the defile against them.

Arabic: وصاروا يقطعون الأشجار العادية قطعًا، ويطرحونها من أعلى الجبل، فلا تمر بأحد إلا أهلكته
English: They cut great trees into sections and rolled them down from above, so that all who were in their way were thrown to destruction.

Arabic: فهلك الكثير من الناس، وأسر الباقون منهم،
English: In this way the greater part of the troops perished, and the rest of them were taken captive.

Arabic: وأخذ الكفار الأموال والأمتعة والخيل والسلاح،
English: The infidels seized the treasures, goods, horses and weapons,

Arabic: ولم يفلت من العسكر إلا ثلاثة من الأمراء
English: and out of the army only three of the amIrs escaped,

Arabic: كبيرهم نكبية وبدر الدين الملك دولة شاه، وثالث لهما لا أذكره،
English: their commander Nukbiya, Badr al-DIn the malik Dawlat-Shah, and a third whose name I do not recall.

Arabic: وهذه الوقيعة أثرت في جيش الهند أثرًا كبيرًا وأضعفته ضعفًا بينًا،
English: This defeat seriously affected the army of India and weakened it in a manifest degree.

Arabic: وصالح السلطان بعدها أهل الجبل على مال يؤدونه إليه؛
English: Afterwards the Sultan made peace with the inhabitants of the mountain on condition of payment of tribute to him,

Arabic: لأن لهم البلاد أسفل الجبل، ولا قدرة لهم على عمارتها إلا بإذنه.
English: because they possess the lands at the bottom of the mountain but they are unable to cultivate them except with his permission.

Arabic: ذكر ثورة الشريف جلال الدين ببلاد المعبر،
English: The revolt of the sharif Jalal al-DTn in the province of al-Ma’bar

Arabic: وما اتصل بذلك من قَتْل ابن أخت الوزير
English: and the death of the vizier’s nephew which was connected with that event.

Arabic: وكان السلطان قد أَمَّرَ على بلاد المعبر — وبينها وبين دهلي مسيرة ستة أشهر — الشريف جلال الدين أحسن شاه،
English: The Sultan had appointed the sharif Jalal al-Din Ahsan-Shah as governor over the province of alMa’bar, which is at a distance of six months’ journey from Dihli.

Arabic: فخالَفَ وادعى المُلْكَ لنفسه،
English: He revolted, claimed the kingship for himself,

Arabic: وقَتَلَ نُوَّاب السلطان وعُمَّاله وضرب الدنانير والدراهم باسمه،
English: killed the Sultan’s military and civil officers, and struck dinars and dirhams with his own name.

Arabic: وكان يكتب في إحدى صفحتي الدينار سلالة طه ويس أبو الفقراء والمساكين جلال الدنيا والدين،
English: He had inscribed on one side of the dinar ‘The offspring of Ta Ha and Ya Sin, the father of the poor and the humble, Jalal al-Dunya wa’d-Din’

Arabic: وفي الصفحة الأخرى الواثق بتأييد الرحمن أحسن شاه السلطان،
English: and on the other side ‘He who puts his trust in the support of the Merciful One, Ahsan-Shah, the Sultan.’

Arabic: وخرج السلطان لما سمع بثورته يريد قتاله،
English: On learning of his revolt the Sultan went out with the object of engaging him in battle

Arabic: فنزل بموضع يقال له كشك زر معناه قصر الذهب، وأقام به ثمانية أيام لقضاء حوائج الناس،
English: and encamped at a place called Kushki Zar (which means Castle of Gold)

Arabic: وفي تلك الأيام يأتي ابن أخت الوزير خواجة جهان
English: During this stay there was brought before him the sister’s son of the vizier Khwaja Jahan,

Arabic: وأربعة من الأمراء أو ثلاثة وهم مقيدون مغلولون،
English: with three or four of the amirs, all of them chained and manacled.

Arabic: وكان السلطان قد بعث وزيره المذكور في مقدمته،
English: The Sultan had sent his vizier with the vanguard of the troops;

Arabic: فوصل إلى مدينة ظهار وهي على مسيرة أربع وعشرين من دهلي وأقام بها أيامًا،
English: on reaching the city of Dhihar, which is a distance of twenty-four days’ journey from Dihli he had stayed there for some days.

Arabic: وكان ابن أخته شجاعًا بطلًا،
English: His sister’s son was a brave and distinguished warrior

Arabic: فاتفق مع الأمراء الذين أتي بهم على قَتْل خاله
English: and he came to an arrangement with those amirs who were arrested [with him] to kill his uncle

Arabic: والهروب بما عنده من الخزائن والأموال إلى الشريف القائم ببلاد المعبر،
English: and to flee to the sharif who had risen in the province of al-Ma’bar with the treasures and moneys which were in the vizier’s possession.

Arabic: وعزموا على الفتك بالوزير عند خروجه إلى صلاة الجمعة،
English: They decided to assassinate the vizier as he came out to attend the Friday prayer,

Arabic: فوشى بهم أحد من أدخلوه في أمرهم إلى الوزير،
English: but one of those whom they had admitted into their plot

Arabic: وكان يسمى الملك نصرة الحاجب، وأخبر الوزير أن آية ما يرومونه لبسهم الدروع تحت ثيابهم،
English: —he was called the malik Nusra, the chamberlain—denounced them to the vizier and told him that the proof of their intention was their wearing breastplates under their outer garments.

Arabic: فبعث الوزير عنهم فوجدهم كذلك، فبعث بهم إلى السلطان.
English: The vizier sent for them and on finding them so dressed sent them to the Sultan.

Arabic: وكنت بين يدي السلطان حين وصولهم، فرأيت أحدهم
English: I was in the Sultan’s suite when they were brought in and I saw one of them,

Arabic: وكان طوال اللحى،
English: he was a tall bearded man,

Arabic: وهو يرعد ويتلو سورة يس،
English: trembling and reciting the sura of Ya Sin.

Arabic: فأمر بهم فطرحوا للفيلة المعلمة لقتل الناس،
English: On the Sultan’s orders they were thrown to the elephants which are trained to kill men,

Arabic: وأمر بابن أخت الوزير، فرد إلى خاله ليقتله فقتله وسنذكر ذلك،
English: and the vizier’s sister’s son was sent back to his uncle to put him to death, which he did as we shall relate later.

Arabic: وتلك الفيلة التي تقتل الناس تكسى أنيابها حدائد مسنونة شبه سكك الحرث،
English: These elephants which kill men have their tusks fitted with pointed blades of iron resembling ploughshares,

Arabic: لها أطراف كالسكاكين،
English: with edges like knives.

Arabic: ويركب الفيال على الفيل،
English: The mahout mounts on the elephant

Arabic: فإذا رمي بالرجل بين يديه لف عليه خرطومه
English: and when a man is thrown before it it winds its trunk round him,

Arabic: ورمى به إلى الهواء،
English: throws him in the air,

Arabic: ثمَّ يتلقفه بنابيه، ويطرحه بعد ذلك بين يديه،
English: then catches him with its tusks and throws him after that at its feet,

Arabic: ويجعل يده على صدره،
English: places one foot upon his chest

Arabic: ويفعل به ما يأمره الفيال على حسب ما أمره السلطان،
English: and does with him what the mahout orders him to do in accordance with the Sultan’s command to him.

Arabic: فإن أمره بتقطيعه قطعه الفيل قطعًا بتلك الحدائد،
English: If he orders him to cut the victim in pieces the elephant cuts him in pieces with those blades;

Arabic: وإن أمر بتركه تركه مطروحًا فسلخ
English: if he orders him to be left alone it leaves him lying on the ground and he is then flayed.

Arabic: وكذلك فعل بهؤلاء،
English: It was this punishment which was inflicted on those amirs,

Arabic: وخرجت من دار السلطان بعد المغرب
English: and when I came out of the Sultan’s encampment at sunset

Arabic: فرأيت الكلاب تأكل لحومهم،
English: I saw the dogs eating their flesh,

Arabic: وقد ملئت جلودهم بالتبن والعياذ بالله،
English: their skins having been stuffed with straw—God preserve us.

Arabic: ولما تجهز السلطان لهذه الحركة
English: When the Sultan made his preparations for this expedition

Arabic: أمرني بالإقامة بالحضرة كما سنذكره،
English: he ordered me to remain at the capital, as we shall relate,

Arabic: ومضى في سفره إلى أن بلغ دولة آباد،
English: and set out on his march until he reached Dawlat Abad.

Arabic: فثار الأمير هلاجون ببلاده وخرج ذلك
English: At this point the amir Halajun rose in rebellion in his province,

Arabic: وكان الوزير خواجة جهان قد بقي أيضًا بالحضرة لحشد الحشود وجمع العساكر.
English: although the vizier Khwaja Jahan had stayed behind in the capital to collect forces and to enlist mounted troops.

Arabic: ذكر ثورة هلاجون
English: The revolt of Halajun.

Arabic: ولما بلغ السلطان إلى دولة آباد وبَعُدَ عن بلاده
English: When the Sultan had reached Dawlat Abad and was thus at a great distance from his province,

Arabic: ثار الأمير هلاجون بمدينة الأهوار، وادعى المُلْك
English: the amir Halajun revolted in the city of Allahur and laid claim to the kingship.

Arabic: وساعده الأمير قلجند على ذلك وصيَّرَه وزيرًا له،
English: He was assisted in this enterprise by the amir Quljund, whom he appointed as vizier to himself.

Arabic: واتصل ذلك بالوزير خواجة جهان وهو بدهلي،
English: On learning of this the vizier Khwaja Jahan, being then in Dihli,

Arabic: فحشد الناس وجمع العساكر، وجمع الخراسانيين
English: collected his forces and assembled the mounted troops and Khurasanians;

Arabic: وكل من كان مقيمًا من الخُدَّام بدهلي أخذ أصحابه وأخذ في الجملة أصحابي؛
English: he took the men of all the officials who were residing in Dihli and amongst them were taken my men,

Arabic: لأني كنت بها مقيمًا
English: because I was staying there.

Arabic: وأعانه السلطان بأميرين كبيرين؛ أحدهما فيران ملك صفدار ومعناه مرتب العساكر،
English: The Sultan gave him the assistance of two high amirs, one being Qiran Malik Saffadar (which means who orders the line of troops)

Arabic: والثاني الملك تمور الشربدار وهو الساقي،
English: and the other the king Tamur the shurbadar (that is to say the cupbearer).

Arabic: وخرج هلاجون بعساكره، فكان اللقاء على ضفة أحد الأودية الكبار،
English: Halajun came out with his troops and the battle was fought on the bank of one of the great rivers.

Arabic: فانهزم هلاجون وهرب وغرق كثير من عساكره في النهر،
English: Halajun was defeated and fled and a large part of his army was drowned in the river.

Arabic: ودخل الوزير المدينة فسلخ بعض أهلها وقتل آخرين بغير ذلك من أنواع القتل،
English: The vizier entered the city, flayed some of its inhabitants and put others to death in various other ways.

Arabic: وكان الذي تولى قَتْلهم محمد بن النجيب نائب الوزير
English: The person who carried out their executions was Muhammad ibn al-Najib, the vizier’s lieutenant,

Arabic: وهو المعروف بأجدر ملك
English: who was known by the name of Ajdar malik,

Arabic: ويسمى أيضًا صك (سك) السلطان — والصك عندهم الكلب —
English: and was also called Sag al-Sultan, sag being the word for ‘dog’ in their language.

Arabic: وكان ظالمًا قاسي القلب، ويسميه السلطان أسد الأسواق،
English: He was a violent and brutal man, and the Sultan used to call him ‘the lion of the bazaars’.

Arabic: وكان ربما عض أرباب الجنايات بأسنانه شرهًا وعدوانًا،
English: He used often to bite persons who were guilty of crimes with his own teeth out of an uncontrollable desire to inflict violence on them.

Arabic: وبعث الوزير من نساء المخالفين نحو ثلاثمائة إلى حصن كاليور فسجن به،
English: The vizier sent about three hundred of the female relatives of the rebels to the fortress of Galiyur where they were imprisoned,

Arabic: ورأيت بعضهن هنالك،
English: and I have myself seen some of them there.

Arabic: وكان أحد الفقهاء له فيهن زوجة، فكان يدخل إليها حتى وَلَدَتْ منه في السجن.
English: One of the doctors of the law had a wife amongst them whom he used to visit, and she even bore a child to him in the prison.

Arabic: ذكر وقوع الوباء في عسكر السلطان
English: The outbreak of plague in the Sultan’s army.

Arabic: ولما وصل السلطان إلى بلاد التلنك وهو قاصد إلى قتال الشريف ببلاد المعبر
English: When the Sultan reached the land of Tiling on his way to engage the Sharif in the province of Ma’bar,

Arabic: نزل مدينة بدركوت (وضبط اسمها بفتح الباء الموحدة وسكون الدال وفتح الراء وضم الكاف وواو وتاء معلوة)،
English: he halted at the city of Badrakut,

Arabic: وهي قاعدة بلاد التلنك (وضبطها بكسر التاء المعلوة واللام وسكون النون وكاف معقودة)، وبينها وبين بلاد المعبر مسيرة ثلاثة أشهر،
English: capital of the province of Tiling, which is at a distance of three months’ march from the land of Ma’bar.

Arabic: ووقع الوباء إذ ذاك في عسكره فهَلَكَ معظمهم،
English: At that moment a pestilence broke out in his army and the greater part of them perished;

Arabic: ومات العبيد والمماليك وكبار الأمراء مثل ملك دولة شاه
English: there died black slaves, the mamluk troopers, and great amirs such as malik Dawlat-Shah,

Arabic: الذي كان السلطان يخاطبه بالعم
English: whom the Sultan used to address by the name of uncle,

Arabic: ومثل أمير عبد الله الهوري، وقد تَقَدَّمَتْ حكايته في السفر الأول،
English: and such as the amir ‘Abdallah al-Harawi, whose story has been related in the first voyage.

Arabic: وهو الذي أَمَرَهُ السلطان أن يرفع من الخزانة ما استطاع من المال،
English: It was he whom the Sultan ordered to carry away from his treasury all the money that he could manage to lift,

Arabic: فربط ثلاث عشرة خريطة بأعضاده ورفعها،
English: and who attached thirteen moneybags to his arms and carried them off.

Arabic: ولما رأى السلطان ما حل بالعسكر عاد إلى دولة آباد
English: When the Sultan saw what had befallen the army he returned to Dawlat Abad.

Arabic: وخالفت البلاد وانتقضت الأطراف،
English: The provinces withdrew their allegiance and the outer regions broke away,

Arabic: وكاد الملك يخرج عن يده لولا ما سبق به القدر من استحكام سعادته.
English: and the sovereignty was on the point of slipping out of his hand had it not been for the prior decree of Providence to reaffirm his good fortune.

Arabic: ذكر الإرجاف بموته وفرار الملك هوشنج
English: The false report of his death and the flight of king Hushanj.

Arabic: ولما عاد السلطان إلى دولة آباد مَرِضَ في طريقه،
English: While on his way back to Dawlat Abad the Sultan fell ill,

Arabic: فأرجف الناس بموته، وشاع ذلك فنشأت عنه فتن عريضة،
English: the rumour of his death was bruited amongst the people and being carried far and wide gave rise to several widespread revolts.

Arabic: وكان الملك هوشنج ابن الملك كمال الدين كرك بدولة آباد،
English: The malik Hushanj son of the malik Kamal al-Din Gurg was at Dawlat Abad

Arabic: وكان بينه وبين السلطان عهد ألَّا يبايِع غيره أبدًا لا في حياته ولا بعد موته،
English: and he had given his solemn oath to the Sultan that he would never take the oath of allegiance to any other person either during the Sultan’s lifetime or after his death.

Arabic: فلما أرجف بموت السلطان
English: When the rumour of the Sultan’s death was circulated,

Arabic: هرب إلى سلطان كافر يسمى بربرة، يسكن بجبال مانعة بين دولة آباد وكوكن تانه،
English: he fled to an infidel Sultan called Burabra who lived in some inaccessible mountains between Dawlat Abad and Kukan Tanah.

Arabic: فعلم السلطان بفراره وخاف وقوع الفتنة، فجَدَّ السير إلى دولة آباد،
English: On learning of his flight, and fearing the outbreak of revolt, the Sultan made a forced march to Dawlat Abad,

Arabic: واقتفى أثر هوشنج وحصره بالخيل،
English: following the trail of Hushanj and surrounded him with cavalry.

Arabic: وأرسل الكافر أن يُسَلِّمه إليه
English: He invited the infidel by letter to surrender him,

Arabic: فأبى وقال: لا أُسَلِّم دخيلي ولو آل بي الأمر لما آل براي كنيلة،
English: but the latter refused saying, I shall never surrender my protege even if I am forced to the same extreme as Ray Kanbila.’

Arabic: وخاف هوشنج على نفسه
English: Hushanj, however, fearing for his own safety,

Arabic: فراسل السلطان،
English: entered into correspondence with the Sultan

Arabic: وعاهَدَ على أن يرحل السلطان إلى دولة آباد، ويبقى هنالك قطلو خان معلم السلطان
English: and made an agreement with him that the Sultan should return to Dawlat Abad and leave at that place his preceptor Qutlu Khan,

Arabic: ليستوثق منه هوشنج، وينزل إليه على الأمان،
English: in order that Hushanj should receive guarantees from him and go down to him upon promise of safety.

Arabic: فرحل السلطان،
English: The Sultan withdrew accordingly,

Arabic: ونزل هوشنج إلى قطلوخان،
English: and Hushanj went down to Qutlu Khan

Arabic: وعاهده ألَّا يقتله السلطان، ولا يحط منزلته،
English: and took a guarantee from him that the Sultan would not put him to death nor lower his rank.

Arabic: وخرج بماله وعياله وأصحابه،
English: He then came out with his possessions, his household and his followers,

Arabic: وقدم على السلطان
English: and presented himself before the Sultan,

Arabic: فسُرَّ بقدومه وأرضاه وخلع عليه،
English: who was rejoiced at his coming and gave him satisfaction and invested him with a robe of honour.

Arabic: وكان قطلو خان صاحب عهد يستنيم الناس إليه، ويقولون في الوفاء عليه
English: Qutlu Khan was a man of his word, in whom men placed implicit confidence and on whose loyalty they relied.

Arabic: ومنزلته عند السلطان عليه وتعظيمه له شديد،
English: His position with the Sultan was very high; the respect which the latter showed to him was immense,

Arabic: ومتى دخل عليه قام له إجلالًا،
English: and whenever he came before him he would rise up in honour of him.

Arabic: فكان بسبب ذلك لا يدخل عليه حتى يكون هو الذي يدعوه؛
English: For this reason therefore Qutlu Khan never used to come into the Sultan’s presence unless he himself should have invited him,

Arabic: لئلا يتعبه بالقيام له،
English: so that he might not weary him by rising to greet him.

Arabic: وهو مُحِبٌّ في الصدقات كثير الإيثار مُولَع بالإحسان للفقراء والمساكين.
English: He was a man who loved to give alms, of great liberality, and eager to do good to poor brethren and the indigent.

Arabic: ذكر ما هَمَّ به الشريف إبراهيم من الثورة ومآل حاله
English: The project of revolt of the sharif Ibrahim and the end of this affair.

Arabic: وكان الشريف إبراهيم المعروف بالخريطة دار وهو صاحب الكاغد والأقلام بدار السلطان
English: The sharlf Ibrahim, who was known as KharTta-dar, that is to say keeper of the paper and the pens in the Sultan’s household,

Arabic: واليًا على بلاد حانسي وسرستي، ولما تحرك السلطان إلى بلاد المعبر
English: was governor of the province of Hansi and Sarsati when the Sultan set out for the land of Ma’bar.

Arabic: وأبوه هو القائم ببلاد المعبر الشريف أحسن شاه،
English: His father was the governor who was in rebellion in the land of Ma’bar, the sharif Ahsan-Shah.

Arabic: فلما أرجف بموت السلطان
English: When the rumour of the Sultan’s death spread abroad,

Arabic: طمع إبراهيم في السلطنة، وكان شجاعًا كريمًا حسن الصورة،
English: Ibrahim, who was brave and generous and had a fine figure, became ambitious of the sultanate.

Arabic: وكنت متزوجًا بأخته حور نسب،
English: I was married to his sister Hurnasab;

Arabic: وكانت صالحة تتهجد بالليل،
English: she was a pious woman, who used to spend part of the night in prayers

Arabic: ولها أوراد من ذكر الله عز وجل،
English: and to compose wirds for the recollection of God (High and Mighty is He)

Arabic: وولدت مني بنتًا
English: and she bore a daughter by me.

Arabic: ولا أدري ما فعل الله فيهما،
English: I do not know what God has done with them both.

Arabic: وكانت تقرأ لكنها لا تكتب،
English: She used to read but not to write.

Arabic: فلما هم إبراهيم بالثورة
English: When Ibrahim proposed to revolt there

Arabic: اجتاز به أمير من أمراء السند معه الأموال يحملها إلى دهلي،
English: passed his way one of the amirs of Sind with revenue moneys which he was carrying to Dihli.

Arabic: فقال له إبراهيم: إنَّ الطريق مخوف وفيه القطع، فأقم عندي حتى يصلح الطريق وأوصلك إلى المأمن،
English: Ibrahim said to him ‘The road is dangerous and infested by robbers; stay with me until the road is in order and I can convey you to safety,’

Arabic: وكان قصده أن يتحقق موت السلطان فيستولي على تلك الأموال،
English: but his real purpose was to get authentic news of the death of the Sultan so that he might take possession of those moneys.

Arabic: فلما تحقق حياته
English: When he was assured of his life

Arabic: سرح ذلك الأمير، وكان يسمى ضياء الملك بن شمس الملك،
English: he released that amir whose name was Diya’ al-Mulk son of Shams al-Mulk.

Arabic: ولما وصل السلطان إلى الحضرة بعد غيبته سنتين ونصف،
English: On the Sultan’s return to the capital after an absence of two and a half years

Arabic: وصل الشريف إبراهيم إليه
English: the sharif Ibrahim came to his court,

Arabic: فوشي به بعض غلمانه،
English: but one of his dependents denounced him

Arabic: وأعلم السلطان بما كان هم به،
English: and told the Sultan of his former intention.

Arabic: فأراد السلطان أن يعجل بقتله
English: The Sultan intended to order his immediate execution

Arabic: ثم تأنى لمحبته فيه،
English: but procrastinated because of his affection for him.

Arabic: فاتفق أن أتى يومًا إلى السلطان بغزال مذبوح
English: It happened that one day there was brought to the Sultan a slaughtered gazelle,

Arabic: ينظر إلى ذبحته،
English: and he looked at the manner of its slaughtering

Arabic: فقال ليس يجيد الذكاة اطرحوه
English: and said ‘It is not properly cut, throw it away.’

Arabic: فرآه إبراهيم فقال: إن زكاته جيدة وأنا آكله،
English: Ibrahim on seeing it said ‘It has been properly slaughtered and I shall eat it,’

Arabic: فأخبر السلطان بقوله،
English: which was told to the Sultan

Arabic: فأنكر ذلك وجعله ذريعة إلى أخذه،
English: and displeased him and furnished him with an excuse to seize him.

Arabic: فأمر به فقُيِّدَ وغُلِّلَ
English: On his orders Ibrahim was chained and manacled,

Arabic: ثم قرره على ما رمى به من أنه أراد أخذ الأموال التي مر بها ضياء الملك،
English: then the Sultan forced him to confess to that of which he had been accused, namely that he intended to seize the moneys which Diya’ alMulk was carrying through.

Arabic: وعلم إبراهيم أنه إنما يريد قتله بسبب أبيه،
English: Ibrahim realized that the Sultan really wished to put him to death because of his father

Arabic: وأنه لا تنفعه معذرة،
English: and that no exculpation would serve him,

Arabic: وخاف أن يُعَذَّب، فرأى الموت خيرًا له
English: so, fearing that he would be put to the torture and seeing death to be preferable for him,

Arabic: فأقر بذلك، فأمر به فوُسِطَ وتُرِكَ هنالك،
English: he acknowledged the charge and on the Sultan’s orders was cut in two and left there.

Arabic: وعادتهم أنه متى قَتَلَ السلطان أحدًا أقام مطروحًا بموضع قَتْله ثلاثًا،
English: It is their custom that when the Sultan puts anyone to death he is left lying at the place of his execution for three days,

Arabic: فإذا كان بعد الثلاث أَخَذَهُ طائفة من الكفار موكلون بذلك،
English: and after the third night a corps of infidels who are charged with that duty take him away

Arabic: فحملوه إلى خندق خارج المدينة يطرحونه به،
English: and carry him to a trench outside the town into which they throw him.

Arabic: وهم يسكنون حول الخندق؛ لئلا يأتي أهل المقتول فيَعْرِفونه،
English: They themselves live round about the trench to prevent the family of the executed man from coming and taking him away,

Arabic: وربما أعطى بعضهم لهؤلاء الكفار مالًا، فتجافوا له عن قتيله حتى يدفنه،
English: but sometimes one of them will give money to these infidels and they give up to him his executed relative so that he may bury him.

Arabic: وكذلك فُعِلَ بالشريف إبراهيم رحمه الله تعالى.
English: This was done in the case of the sharif Ibrahim, God have mercy on him.

Arabic: ذكر خلاف نائب السلطان ببلاد التلنك
English: The rebellion of the Sultan’s lieutenant in the province of Tiling.

Arabic: ولما عاد السلطان من التلنك وشاع خبر موته،
English: When the Sultan returned from Tiling and the report of his death spread abroad,

Arabic: وكان ترك تاج الملك نصرة خان نائبًا عنه ببلاد التلنك، وهو من قدماء خواصه بلغه ذلك،
English: it reached the ears of Taj alMulk Nusra Khan, whom he had left as his deputy in the province of Tiling and who was one of his intimates of long standing.

Arabic: فعمل عزاء السلطان،
English: This man having performed and carried out the memorial services for the Sultan,

Arabic: ودعا لنفسه وبايعه الناس بحضرة بدركوت،
English: proclaimed his own sovereignty and the people took the oath of allegiance to him in the capital city of Badrakut

Arabic: فبلغ خبره إلى السلطان، فبعث معلمه قطلو خان في عساكر عظيمة،
English: When the news of this reached the Sultan he sent his preceptor Qutlu Khan with an immense body of troops,

Arabic: فحصره بعد قتال شديد، هلك فيه أمم من الناس،
English: who besieged him after a violent battle in which whole tribes of men perished.

Arabic: واشتدَّ الحصار على أهل بدركوت وهي منيعة،
English: The siege pressed heavily upon the people of Badrakut, although it was difficult of approach,

Arabic: وأخذ قطلو خان في نقبها، فخرج إليه نصرة خان على الأمان في نفسه
English: and when Qutlu Khan began to undermine it Nusra Khan went out to him with a safe-conduct.

Arabic: فأمنه، وبعث به إلى السلطان،
English: Qutlu Khan gave him a promise of safety and sent him to the Sultan,

Arabic: وأمن أهل المدينة والعسكر.
English: and also pardoned the inhabitants of the city and the troops.

Arabic: ذكر انتقال السلطان لنهر الكنك وقيام عين الملك
English: The Sultan’s removal to the river Gang and the rising of ‘Ain al-Mulk.

Arabic: ولما استولى القحط على البلاد
English: When the land was in the grip of famine

Arabic: انْتَقَلَ السلطان بعساكره إلى نهر الكنك الذي تَحُجُّ إليه الهنود على مسيرة عشر من دهلي،
English: the Sultan removed with his troops to the river Gang, to which the Indians go on pilgrimage, at a distance of ten days from Dihli.

Arabic: وأَمَرَ الناس بالبناء،
English: He gave orders to his men to erect buildings;

Arabic: وكانوا قبل ذلك صنعوا خيامًا من حشيش الأرض،
English: before this they had made tents of grasses,

Arabic: فكانت النار كثيرًا ما تقع فيها، وتؤذي الناس
English: which used frequently to catch fire and cause losses to the people,

Arabic: حتى كانوا يصنعون كهوفًا تحت الأرض،
English: until they adopted the habit of making caves under the earth

Arabic: فإذا وقعت النار رَمَوْا أمتعتهم بها وسدوا عليها بالتراب،
English: and when a fire occurred they threw their goods into them and covered them over with earth.

Arabic: ووَصَلْتُ أنا في تلك الأيام لمحلة السلطان،
English: I myself arrived about that time at the Sultan’s camp.

Arabic: وكانت البلاد التي بغربي النهر حيث السلطان
English: The districts which were west of the river, where the Sultan was,

Arabic: شديدة القحط
English: were suffering from severe famine,

Arabic: والبلاد التي بشرقيه خصبة،
English: while the districts to the east of it were abundantly provisioned.

Arabic: وأميرها عين الملك بن ماهر،
English: The governor of the latter was “Ain al-Mulk ibn Mahir,

Arabic: ومنها مدينة عوض ومدينة ظفر آباد ومدينة اللكنو وغيرها،
English: and they included the city of ‘Awd and the city of Zafar Abad and the city of Al-Laknaw, with others.

Arabic: وكان الأمير عين الملك كل يوم يحضر خمسين أَلْفَ مَنٍّ؛ منها قمح وأرز وحمص لعلف الدواب،
English: The amir ‘Ain al-Mulk used to furnish 50,000 maunds daily, partly in wheat, rice, and chickpeas as fodder for the animals.

Arabic: فأمر السلطان أن تُحْمَل الفيلة ومعظم الخيل والبغال إلى الجهة الشرقية المخصبة
English: The Sultan gave orders that the elephants and most of the horses and mules should be transported to the eastern district where there was abundance,

Arabic: لترعى هنالك،
English: to pasture there,

Arabic: وأوصى عين الملك بحفظها.
English: and he instructed ‘Ain al-Mulk to guard them.

Arabic: وكان لعين الملك أربعة إخوة، وهم شهر الله ونصر الله وفضل الله ولا أذكر اسم الآخر،
English: ‘Ain al-Mulk had four brothers named Shahrallah, Nasrallah, Fadlallah, and I do not remember the name of the fourth;

Arabic: فاتفقوا مع أخيهم عين الملك على أن يأخذوا فيلة السلطان ودوابه،
English: they made an agreement with their brother ‘Ain al-Mulk to seize the Sultan’s elephants and riding beasts,

Arabic: ويبايعوا عين الملك، ويقوموا على السلطان،
English: to acknowledge ‘Ain al-Mulk as their king and to rise against the Sultan.

Arabic: وهرب إليهم عين الملك بالليل، وكاد الأمر يتم لهم،
English: ‘Ain al-Mulk fled to join them by night and their plan very nearly succeeded.

Arabic: ومن عادة ملك الهند أن يَجْعَلَ مع كل أميرٍ كبيرٍ أو صغيرٍ
English: It is the custom of the King of India to set alongside every amir, great or small,

Arabic: مملوكًا له يكون عينًا عليه، ويُعَرِّفه بجميع حاله،
English: a mamluk of his, to spy upon him and keep him informed of everything to do with him.

Arabic: ويجعل أيضًا جواري في الدور يَكُنَّ عيونًا له على أمرائه
English: He also places slave girls in their houses, who act as spies for him upon his amirs,

Arabic: ونسوة يسميهن الكناسات،
English: as well as women whom they call sweepers,

Arabic: يدخلن الدور بلا استئذان،
English: who come into the houses without asking permission.

Arabic: ويخبرهن الجواري بما عندهن،
English: The slave girls pass on their information to those women

Arabic: فيخبر الكناسات بذلك المخبرين، فيُخْبَر بذلك السلطان،
English: and the sweepers in turn pass that on to the ‘king’ of the intelligencers, who then informs the Sultan of it.

Arabic: ويذكرون أن بعض الأمراء كان في فراشه مع زوجته،
English: They tell a story that a certain amir was in bed with his wife

Arabic: فأراد مماستها
English: and wished to have intercourse with her;

Arabic: فحَلَّفَتْه برأس السلطان ألَّا يفعل فلم يسمع منها،
English: she adjured him by the head of the Sultan not to do so but he would not listen to her,

Arabic: فبعث عنه السلطان صباحًا وأخبره بذلك وكان سبب هلاكه،
English: and in the morning the Sultan sent for him and told him the whole story, and that brought him to his death.

Arabic: وكان للسلطان مملوك يُعْرَف بابن ملك شاه هو عين على عين الملك المذكور،
English: The Sultan had a mamluk named Ibn Malik-Shah who was a spy upon this ‘Ain al-Mulk.

Arabic: فأخبر السلطان بفراره وجوازه النهر،
English: When he informed the Sultan of his flight and crossing of the river,

Arabic: فسُقِطَ في يده وظن أنها القاضية عليه؛
English: the Sultan bitterly repented of his action and thought that this was the decisive blow for himself,

Arabic: لأن الخيل والفيلة والزرع كل ذلك عند عين الملك
English: because horses, elephants, grain, all of them, were with ‘Ain al-Mulk,

Arabic: وعساكر السلطان مفترقة،
English: and his own troops were widely scattered.

Arabic: فأراد أن يقصد حضرته،
English: He proposed therefore to go to the capital,

Arabic: ويجمع العساكر،
English: collect mounted troops,

Arabic: وحينئذٍ يأتي لقتاله،
English: and then come back to engage him in battle,

Arabic: وشاوَرَ أرباب الدولة في ذلك،
English: and consulted the chief officers of the kingdom on this plan.

Arabic: وكان أمراء خراسان والغرباء أشد الناس خوفًا من هذا القائم؛
English: The amirs of Khurasan and the foreigners were in the greatest fear of this rebel,

Arabic: لأنه هندي،
English: because he was an Indian,

Arabic: وأهل الهند مبغضون في الغرباء لإظهار السلطان لهم،
English: and the people of India hold the foreigners in hatred because of the Sultan’s favouritism for them.

Arabic: فكرهوا ما ظهر له
English: They were in consequence opposed to his idea

Arabic: وقالوا: يا خوند عالم إن فعلت ذلك بَلَغَهُ الخبر، فاشتد أَمْره
English: and said ‘O Master of the World, if you do this, he will learn of it and his position will be strengthened;

Arabic: ورتب العساكر، وانثال عليه طلاب الشر ودعاة الفتن،
English: he will enrol troopers and will become a leader to whom all evilseeking men and fermenters of rebellions will flock,

Arabic: والأَوْلى معاجلته قبل استحكام قوته.
English: so the best plan is to get a blow in quickly before his power is established.’

Arabic: وكان أول من تَكَلَّمَ بهذا ناصر الدين مطهر الأوهري،
English: The first man to speak in this sense was Nasir al-Din Mutahhar al-Awhari,

Arabic: ووافقه جميعهم
English: and all of them supported him.

Arabic: فعمل السلطان بإشارتهم،
English: The Sultan accordingly acted on their advice;

Arabic: وكتب تلك الليلة إلى من قرب منه من الأمراء والعساكر، فأتوا من حينهم،
English: he wrote that same night to those of the amirs and regular troops who were in his neighbourhood and they came forthwith.

Arabic: وأدار في ذلك حيلة حسنة،
English: In this connection he adopted an excellent ruse;

Arabic: فكان إذا قدم على محلته مثلًا مائةُ فارس
English: whenever a hundred horsemen for example arrived at his camp

Arabic: بعث الآلاف من عنده للقائهم ليلًا،
English: he sent out some thousands of those who were with him to meet them by night

Arabic: ودخلوا معهم إلى المحلة كان جميعهم مدد له،
English: and these came in with them to the camp as though the whole body of them were reinforcements for him.

Arabic: وتَحَرَّك السلطان في ساحل النهر
English: The Sultan marched out along the bank of the river

Arabic: ليجعل مدينة قنوج وراء ظهره،
English: in order to place the city of Qinnawj behind his back

Arabic: ويتحصن بها لمنعتها وحصانتها،
English: and to use it as a fortress because of its strength and fortifications.

Arabic: وبينها وبين الموضع الذي كان به ثلاثة أيام،
English: It lay at a distance of three days’ march from the position which he occupied.

Arabic: فرحل أول مرحلة وقد عبأ جيشه للحرب،
English: When he set off on the first stage he disposed his army in battle order,

Arabic: وجعله صفًّا واحدًا عند نزولهم،
English: and on their halting he formed them in a single line,

Arabic: كل واحد منهم بين يديه سلاحه وفرسه إلى جانبه،
English: each man of them having his weapons in front of him and his horse by his side.

Arabic: ومعه خباء صغير يأكل به ويتوضأ ويعود إلى مجلسه
English: He had with him a small tent in which he used to eat and make his ablutions and then return to his post;

Arabic: والمحلة الكبرى على بعد منهم،
English: the main mahalla was at some distance from them

Arabic: ولم يدخل السلطان في تلك الأيام الثلاثة خباء ولا استظل بظل،
English: and during those three days the Sultan never entered a tent nor shaded himself with any cover.

Arabic: وكنت في يوم منها بخبائي، فصاح بي فتًى من فتياني اسمه سنبل، واستعجلني
English: On one of these days I was in my tent when one of my eunuchs named Sunbul called out my name and urged me to make haste.

Arabic: وكان معي الجواري،
English: I had with me my slavegirls,

Arabic: فخرجت إليه
English: and when I went out to him

Arabic: فقال: إن السلطان أَمَرَ الساعة أن يُقْتَلَ كُلُّ مَنْ معه امرأته أو جاريته،
English: he said ‘The Sultan has this hour given orders that every person who has with him his wife or his slave girl shall be put to death.’

Arabic: فشفع عنده الأمراء،
English: After the amirs had interceded with him,

Arabic: فأمر ألَّا تبقى الساعة بالمحلة امرأة،
English: however, he commanded that there should not remain a single woman in the mahalla forthwith

Arabic: وأن يُحْمَلْنَ إلى حصن هنالك
English: and that they should be transported to a castle thereabouts,

Arabic: على ثلاثة أميال يقال له كنبيل،
English: at a distance of three miles, called Kanbil,

Arabic: فلم تَبْقَ امرأة بالمحلة ولا مع السلطان،
English: so no woman was left in the mahalla, not even with the Sultan.

Arabic: وبِتْنَا تلك الليلة على تعيئة، فلما كان في اليوم الثاني رَتَّبَ السلطان عسكره أفواجًا،
English: We passed that night in battle order and on the following morning the Sultan organised his army in troops,

Arabic: وجَعَلَ مع كل فوج الفيلة المدرعة عليها الأبراج فوقها المقاتلة،
English: each troop being given mailed elephants carrying towers filled with fighting men.

Arabic: وتَدَرَّعَ العسكر، وتهيئوا للحرب، وباتوا تلك الليلة على أهبة.
English: The soldiers having put on their armour and made ready for battle passed that night under arms.
